name: Saltmarsh Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt and ritual-reagent supplier for coastal trade
economy_niches: Reed and peat harvesting for shipyards and fuel
culture_adjustments: Local timekeeping uses micro-tide cycles rather than broad sea-calendar
Guild ownership of pans and flats central to social order
Ship-naming rituals adapted to salt-works (pan/pond and crew oaths)
Ancestor rites emphasize drowned kin and tidal offerings
constraints: Unstable, waterlogged ground limits heavy construction
High soil salinity prevents cereal agriculture
Ritual processing depends on scarce imported reagents
notes: Evaporation pans largely guild-owned and significant state tax revenue
Local Coastal Tongues dialect rich in saltwork jargon
Key node for provisioning ships and supplying ritual economies
